tn.text: Here "built up" means to build walls around a city so that the city can be defended from attackers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: sent the commanders of his armies against the cities
tn.text: "sent his armies to attack the cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Ijon, Dan, Abelmaim ... storage cities of Naphtali

tn.text: "he commanded his troops to stop fortifying Ramah and doing other work there. " (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Timbers are large pieces of wood used to build houses or walls.

tn.ref: Were not the Ethiopians and the Libyans a huge army, with very many chariots and horsemen?
tn.text: AT: "The Ethiopians and the Libyans were a huge army, with very many chariots and horsemen." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: the eyes of Yahweh run everywhere
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh sees what is happening all over the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: so that he might show himself strong on behalf of
tn.text: AT: "and Yahweh protects with his strength"

tn.ref: those whose hearts are perfect toward him
tn.text: AT: "those who are completely committed to following him"

tn.ref: The Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel
tn.text: This is a book that no longer exists.

tn.ref: Asa was diseased in his feet
tn.text: AT: "Asa had a disease in his feet"
A bier is a table on which a dead body is placed at a funeral.

tn.ref: sweet odors and various kinds of spices prepared by skilled perfumers
tn.text: Putting plants that smell good with the dead body was one of the burial customs of the people of Israel. AT: "sweet smelling plants prepared by people skilled in this custom"
